description: Warner Bros urged shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's takeover, favoring a Netflix offer they believe benefits customers and aligns with board duties. Paramount's higher bid includes cable networks, unlike Netflix's streaming-focused proposal. Both deals face significant regulatory and political scrutiny, with concerns about market dominance and media consolidation.

Huge blow! Shubman Gill to miss fourth T20I vs South Africa due to toe injury
description: Shubman Gill picked up the injury during training on Wednesday, putting his availability for the Playing XI in doubt. Team management is expected to take a final call at the toss. India currently lead the five-match series 2-1.

title: Urologist explains why you feel a ‘sudden or urgent need to pee while you are stressed or anxious’
How police secretly tracked missing coach Travis Turner before abuse charges
description: Experts believe fugitive football coach Travis Turner was likely caught through a secret police sting or flagged online activity. Authorities say Turner faces 10 child pornography-related charges. While police remain silent, criminologists told the Daily Mail that undercover officers, tech company reports, or device searches likely led to the case.

Trump, troops and trouble at home: Why Asim Munir's next move could shake Pakistan
description: Pakistan army chief, Asim Munir is facing a critical challenge in his way of constantly rising to power as the US presses Islamic Republic to contribute troops to a Gaza stabilisation force. This move could trigger significant opposition within Pakistan. Munir's upcoming visit to Washington is expected to focus on this sensitive issue. Analysts warn of potential domestic unrest if Pakistan agrees to the deployment.

Nuclear Energy Bill 2025: Lok Sabha clears 'SHANTI' bill as opposition walks out
description: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday SHANTI Bill, 2025, paving the way for private sector participation in India's nuclear energy industry. This legislation (yet to be passed in Rajya Sabha) introduces a new civil liability framework and strengthens the Atomic Energy Regulatory Board. While crucial operations remain government-controlled, the bill aims to boost nuclear power capacity and applications, encouraging investment in the sector.

Pushpa 2 star Sreeleela slams AI deepfakes, makes emotional appeal
description: Actress Sreeleela has strongly urged social media users to reject AI-generated content, emphasizing the crucial difference between using and abusing technology. She highlighted the serious safety concerns AI misuse poses to film industry professionals, particularly women, and expressed hope for authorities to intervene. Sreeleela's upcoming projects include 'Parasakthi' and 'Ustaad Bhagat Singh'.

title: ‘Warmongering threats’: Venezuela denounces Trump’s ‘total and complete’ ship blockade order
‘Behave responsibly’: BJP slams Rahul over remarks in Germany, says shows his sentiments for India
description: The BJP on Wednesday hit back at Rahul Gandhi over the his criticism of Centre's manufaturing policy during his visit to Germany. BJP MP Sambit Patra salmmed leader of opposition in Lok Sabha accusing him of insulting India on foreign soil at a time when parliament is in session. He  saying, LoP is a responsibe position and should behave  in “responsible manner."

title: 'Other franchises were sleeping': Ashwin shocked as MI snap up de Kock for Rs 1 cr
description: Mumbai Indians made a smart acquisition in the IPL 2026 mini auction. They secured Quinton de Kock for Rs 1 crore. This move adds firepower to their top order. Ravichandran Ashwin praised the strategic buy. Mumbai Indians look stronger after the auction. They also added other players to their lineup.

Despite a mixed last season, Pathirana attracted intense bidding, with KKR securing him and Mustafizur Rahman as a smart backup. Srikkanth questioned the aggressive pursuit, comparing it to other players who faltered after one poor season.

He accuses tech billionaires of driving AI expansion for personal gain, potentially leading to massive unemployment and social isolation. Sanders also highlighted the immense electricity demands of AI infrastructure, warning of taxpayer burdens.

description: Delhi environment minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Wednesday announced that his government is launching its own carpooling app as the pollution level rises in National capital. He also announced a Rs 2700-crore allocation over 10 years to the MCD.

description: The Supreme Court has revised its order on older vehicles, now targeting those failing BS-IV emission standards amid Delhi's severe air pollution. The court also urged practical solutions, including temporary suspension of nine toll plazas to curb traffic congestion and pollution. Direct financial aid for affected construction workers was also discussed.

description: Gitikka Ganju Dhar plays Shabnam Jamali, a wild, bossy Pakistani politician’s wife in Aditya Dhar’s spy thriller 'Dhurandhar'. She said yes instantly on hearing his name, calling him the “biggest star” for his clarity and detail. Acting opposite Rakesh Bedi, she “had to pack a punch.”

title: 'Mamata must clarify': BJP claims TMC MP Kirti Azad vaped inside Lok Sabha; shares video
description: The BJP shared a video alleging Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Kirti Azad vaped inside the Lok Sabha. BJP MP Anurag Thakur had previously complained to the Speaker. The incident is being taken seriously. Lok Sabha Secretariat sources stated that appropriate action will follow examination of the recordings. The alleged act is a serious violation of parliamentary conduct and rules.

description: Uttar Pradesh minister Sanjay Nishad defended his controversial remark on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's action with a woman's hijab, citing translation issues and regional dialect differences. He claimed his comment was misunderstood and lacked ill intent. Opposition parties, however, intensified their demand for an unconditional apology, calling his statement misogynistic and undignified.

description: State Sports Minister Aroop Biswas has stepped down temporarily following public outrage over the botched Lionel Messi event. The Chief Minister will oversee the sports portfolio until a fair inquiry is completed. This move aims to quell public anger and deflect opposition criticism, though Biswas retains other ministerial roles.

Message for Trump? FM Sitharaman says 'tariffs weaponised trade'; clears India's negotiation stand
description: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted that global trade is increasingly being weaponized through tariffs and other measures. She warned India must negotiate carefully in this evolving landscape, where trade is no longer free and fair. Sitharaman emphasised that India's actions aim to protect domestic industries from unfair competition and predatory practices.

title: 'Kept begging': How delay & refusals led to Bengaluru man’s death on road; wife donates his eyes
description: A 34-year-old mechanic died after a scooter fall while being rushed to the hospital following a heart attack. His wife alleges that a private hospital's delay in treatment and the apathy of passing motorists contributed to his death. She is demanding action against the hospital and urging for greater public compassion.

title: H-1B visa row: Social media vetting triggers 221(g) slips; how future processing is affected
description: US visa applicants, particularly H-1B and H-4 holders, are facing increased scrutiny with consular officers reportedly asking about social media privacy settings. This has led to more 221(g) slips, indicating a temporary visa denial requiring further information. Applicants have one year to provide requested documents to avoid reapplying.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
description: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5%, at its European headquarters in Luxembourg, impacting software developers most due to AI advancements. This is company's biggest ever job cuts in the Europe, following global layoffs back in October and a negotiated social plan. Despite the reduction, Luxembourg remains a strategic European hub for Amazon, which continues to hire in key areas.

title: Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for NBA legend Stephen Curry
description: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's love story began in childhood at church, though they didn't start dating until their teenage years. Ayesha's unwavering support, even encouraging Stephen to finish his degree before the NBA draft, solidified his decision to marry her. Their enduring marriage has weathered public scrutiny, with Stephen consistently crediting his wife.
